name: dbViewer
author: ShayKisten

sections.description:
View your WordPress database tables and data from your WordPress admin dashboard.
It is great if you are developing your own plugin and need to see if your tables have been created or if data has been changed in your created table.
It can also be used by your normal day to day users to view information like comments, posts and users within their respective database tables.
You will also be able to view the tables that are created when you install plugins and how these plugins are storing data.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin to the “/wp-content/plugins/” directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Can I edit database data through this plugin?

No. This plugin can only view data in you WordPress database.
